meanings.definition: To reverse one's previous position or opinion.
meanings.sent1: She quickly backpedaled on her decision to go to the party.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often backpedal on their promises after being elected.
meanings.sent3: The comedian had to backpedal on his joke when the audience didn't find it funny.
meanings.sent4: After realizing his mistake, he had to backpedal to correct the error.
meanings.sent5: Backpedaling on his statement only made the situation more confusing.

meanings.definition: To retreat or move backwards, especially in a defensive manner.
meanings.sent1: The soccer player had to backpedal to defend against the opponent's attack.
meanings.sent2: The army was forced to backpedal when they encountered unexpected resistance.
meanings.sent3: The cat had to backpedal when it accidentally walked into a room full of dogs.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was backpedaling in her career after making a wrong move.
meanings.sent5: Backpedaling away from the edge of the cliff, he felt a sense of relief.
